pullrequest.title: Fix OgreText rendering of multi-line strings

content.raw:
Thanks a lot for this fix!

Overall, the change seems reasonable to me, and will match expectations more for what newline does.  I do have a couple of concerns:

1.  In delphyne we are currently on Xenial, and are using commit 2470a8191729 for ignition-rendering as our head.  Updating to this branch makes it so that we require CMake 3.10, which won’t work on Xenial.  I tested this out by just porting the code to that commit, but we may have to consider how to make this work with Xenial for us to get the fix.
2. While I think making \\n the newline character is the correct thing to do, I’m slightly concerned that “old” code ported from Gazebo may expect the Carriage Return / NEL to make a newline.  If backwards compatibility here is not a concern, feel free to ignore this comment :slight_smile: 

Thoughts?
content.html:
Thanks a lot for this fix!

Overall, the change seems reasonable to me, and will match expectations more for what newline does. I do have a couple of concerns:

  1. In delphyne we are currently on Xenial, and are using commit 2470a8191729 for ignition-rendering as our head. Updating to this branch makes it so that we require CMake 3.10, which won’t work on Xenial. I tested this out by just porting the code to that commit, but we may have to consider how to make this work with Xenial for us to get the fix.
  2. While I think making \n the newline character is the correct thing to do, I’m slightly concerned that “old” code ported from Gazebo may expect the Carriage Return / NEL to make a newline. If backwards compatibility here is not a concern, feel free to ignore this comment

Thoughts?

pullrequest.title: Fix OgreText rendering of multi-line strings

content.raw:
1. Got it. I'll port this patch to base it off the `default` branch 
2. Backwards compatibility is currently not a concern because we don’t have anything that uses this text feature apart from delphyne.
content.html:
1. Got it. I'll port this patch to base it off the default branch
  2. Backwards compatibility is currently not a concern because we don’t have anything that uses this text feature apart from delphyne.

content.raw: The fix looks good on the default branch for me.  I’ll still approve this one and let you figure out how to merge these two.
